text_en: A good way to guide blind people is to let the person grasp your arm directly above the elbow. Never grab the personâ€™s arm or try to direct him or her by pushing or pulling.
Different roughness on the tiles makes it easier to orientate around campus
When walking stairs it is good to have some support. The different roughness on the tiles in front of the stairs lets the blind know it is an obstacle ahead.
To guide a person to a seat, place the hand of your guiding arm on the seat. The person you are guiding will find the seat by following along your arm.
